FAQ
Size
Why there is no response after connecting the TC001、TS001 to a phone?

Follow the steps below to identify the problem:
a) Check if your phone is on Android version 6.0 or above. 
b) Check if the OTG is available in your phone Settings and if it is ON. For some phones, search for OTG in the Settings menu and turn it on manually. 
c) Check if the blue LED indicator on the TC001、TS001 is lit. If not, your phone may not be properly connected to the device, or your phone may not support OTG functions. 
d) Check if you have downloaded the app and given it the necessary authorization. 
e) Disconnect and plug in the TC001、TS001 again. If there is still no response, please contact customer support.
What if the image is not clear and the temperature is not accurate?
The uncooled infrared detectors require periodic refreshing of the screen by pressing the shutter icon on the upper right. This ensures a clearer image and more accurate temperature measurement.
Can the TC001、TS001 perform readings underwater, through glass windows, through clothes, or under skin?
The infrared detector can detect long-wave infrared regions of 8~14um, and can only measure the surface temperature of an object. It cannot measure temperature through water or glass.
Why is the measured temperature not precise?

The temperature resolution of the TC001、TS001 is ±2%, with a normal temperature range of –20~150°C (-4~302°F) , and high temperature range of 150–550°C (302~1022°F). Please select the corresponding range in the app before testing.
Does the TC001、TS001 emit radiation harmful to people\'s health?
The TC001、TS001 does not emit any harmful radiation and only collects heat information about an object.
Why does the temperature reading increase when I get closer to the device?

Infrared radiation attenuates after passing through the atmosphere. The longer the distance, the stronger the attenuation, causing the accuracy of temperature measured at a distance to decrease. For users who need to get accurate temperature data, they can enter the distance to be measured (maximum 5 meters) in Personal Information - Settings - Temperature Correction - Distance to Spot, to get the corrected temperature.
Why there is a clicking sound? What does "shutter moving" mean?

The temperature of the infrared imager will change slightly during use. Therefore, a periodic internal temperature calibration is needed. The micro motor controlled activation or deactivation of such internal calibration makes such a sound, which is known in the industry as "shutter moving".
How do I update the firmware?
Firmware updates can be downloaded from the official website or through the app when available. Follow the instructions provided with the update package.
What is the operating temperature range?
The operating temperature range is -10°C to +50°C (14°F to 122°F).
What is the measurement accuracy?
The measurement accuracy is ±2°C or ±2% of reading, whichever is greater.
How do I calibrate the device?
Calibration is performed automatically. Manual calibration can be done through the settings menu.
What is the battery life?
Battery life depends on usage but typically provides 4-6 hours of continuous operation.
How do I connect to WiFi?
Go to Settings > WiFi and select your network. Enter the password when prompted.
